docs.text: in french , the phrase " film noir " literally means " black film . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: webster defines it as " a type of crime film featuring cynical malevolent characters in a sleazy setting and an ominous atmosphere that is conveyed by shadowy photography and foreboding background music . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: classic film noir , including such memorable fare as " the big sleep , " the original " cape fear , " and orson welles' striking " a touch of evil , " employed black and white photography to emphasize the long shadows associated with the genre .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: color came into play with neo-noir films like " chinatown " and " blade runner . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " l . a . confidential , " easily the best film of 1997 , is a wonderful piece of contemporary neo-noir filmmaking .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for a textbook example of how to take all the elements of neo-noir and create an absolute mess , there's " palmetto . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: based on " just another sucker , " a short story written by british author rene raymond under the pseudonym james hadley chase , " palmetto " shows what happens when a filmmaker puts style ahead of substance .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: director volker schlondorff ( " tin drum , " the handmaid's tale " ) stated " we weren't even sure for a long time if it was going to be a thriller or a comedy . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it shows .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " palmetto " is too preposterous too be taken seriously as a thriller and too ponderous to work as a comedy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the story begins when journalist harry barber ( woody harrelson ) is released from prison .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: someone turned state's witness and revealed that harry was framed , a " reward " for blowing the lid on corruption in the small florida town of palmetto .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: bitter and broke , harry plans to hitchhike to miami and start his life over , but ex-girlfriend nina ( gina gershon ) appears to return him to palmetto .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while hanging out at a bar , he notices that a beautiful woman has left her purse in a phone booth .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: harry pockets her cash , only to have the woman reappear and catch him with her money in his pocket .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: no problem , though .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the radiant blonde is rhea malroux ( elisabeth shue , ) the young wife of a very rich older man with heart problems , and she has a proposition for harry .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: rhea needs " a threatening voice and someone to collect the ransom " for the staged kidnapping of her teenage stepdaughter odette ( chloe sevigny . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the girls want to bilk a half-million dollar " ransom " from the old man and will happily give harry $50 , 000 for helping with the scam .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: things go wrong , of course .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: odette is found dead , leaving harry frantically trying to dispose of the corpse and cover his tracks .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in an ironic twist , harry is asked to work for the local d . a . 's
docs.label: negative

docs.text: office .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they need a press liaison to field questions about odette's kidnapping and feel that harry is the perfect man for the job .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not a bad set-up for a noir film , if only schlondorff knew how to handle the material , but he never settles on a consistent tone .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the actors don't know what to do with their characters either , muddling the proceedings even further .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as if that wasn't enough , the story suffers from major problems in logic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: woody harrelson is a talented actor with an admirable willingness to take on risky parts , but he's lost here .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: presented as a crusading journalist who was horribly wronged , it makes no sense that harry would be stupid and dishonest enough to get caught up in this scheme .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: harrelson clearly doesn't know what to do with harry's character , so he spends most of the film glowering , sweating and generally acting miserable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: meanwhile , elisabeth shue gives a goofy performance , behaving like a vamp on nitrous oxide .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as the stepdaughter , chloe sevigny lays on so many slurpy quirks that she comes off like juliette lewis jr . despite a number of steamy scenes , there's no chemistry between harrelson and the women .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to make matters worse , schlondorff badly dubs in dialogue while the character's lips are running over each others bodies .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: two particularly bad scenes highlight the film's problems .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while driving with a body in his trunk , harry has a minor car wreck and a cop shows up .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the officer wants to help change harry's flat tire and asks him to open the trunk .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: harry's pathetic attempts to keep the trunk closed might have worked if played as comedy , but under schlondorff's grim direction , the scene is just embarrassing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film's nadir comes when a bad guy prepares to kill harry and nina .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we're supposed to be horrified watching our hero dangling over a bathtub filled with acid , but by this point the film has foundered so badly that the scene is merely reminiscent of when jessica and roger rabbit were suspended over a vat of dip .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: had " palmetto " been played with tongue firmly in cheek , it might have been an entertaining shaggy dog story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but under the harsh direction of schlondorff , the film is just a sluggish paint-by-numbers exercise in neo- noir cluelessness .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: avoid this nonsense and go see " l . a . confidential " instead .
docs.label: negative
